Value.label: Power delta
Value.Help: Consumer variation required to send notification. From 1 to 100, default 10

Value.label: No communication light
Value.Help: After how many minutes the GreenWave device should start flashing if the controller didn't communicate with this device

Value.label: Room color
Value.Help: The room color (Corner wheel color) on the GreenWave device

Value.label: Power on relay
Value.Help: Relais state after a power loss

Value.label: LED on network error
Value.Help: Enable/Disable the LED on network error

Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes on Power On
Value.Help: Stay awake for 10 minutes after batteries are inserted

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: How long should the device associated to multi sensor keep state On before sending it Off command (if the value is bigger than 255, the value would be rounded to next integer in minutes)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered OZW Ideal Value is Binary Sensor Report

Value.label: Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Enable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in the threshold settings. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. When the unit is Celsius, threshold=Value. 2. When the unit is Fahrenheit, threshold=Value*1.8. The accuracy is 0.1. 3. The high byte is the part of integer, the low byte is the fractional part.

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. Note: The accuracy is 0.1. The high byte is the part of integer, the low byte is the fractional part.

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Battery Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report. Note: The accuracy is 0.1. The high byte is the part of integer, the low byte is the fractional part.

Value.label: Low Temp Alarm
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send the alarm report of low temperature(Less than 15 Degress C)

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 1. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 2. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 3. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Enable/disable Lock Configuration
Value.Help: Enable/disable Lock Configuration

Value.label: Reset to default
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush 2 relays module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Turn off Q1 after set time
Value.Help: When Q1 relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an ON command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15

Value.label: Turn on Q1 after set time
Value.Help: When Q1 relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an OFF command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15

Value.label: Turning off Q2 after set time
Value.Help: When Q2 relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an ON command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15

Value.label: Turning on Q2 after set time
Value.Help: When Q2 relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after set time. The timer is reset to zero every time the module receives an OFF command from any source. Value is in 1s or 10ms depending on parameter 15

Value.label: Turning on/off s or ms selection
Value.Help: Select the time units for auto on/off configuration. Applies tot he whole device

Value.label: Saving the state of the 2 relays after a power failure

Item.label: Flush 2 relays module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush 2 relays module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0%- 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0%- 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 1 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 1 65535) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 65535 = 1 second - 65535 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s)

Value.label: Output Q1 switch selection
Value.Help: Type of device that is connected to the output (NC or NO)

Item.label: When the switch is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When the switch is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO)

Value.label: Output Q2 switch selection
Value.Help: Type of device that is connected to the output (NC or NO)

Item.label: When the switch is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When the switch is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO)

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. Available configuration parameters : default value 32536. 32536 offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 = value from 0.1C to 10.0C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 = value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters : 0 = reporting disabled. 1 to 127 = 0,1C to 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value is 5 = 0,5C

Group.label: Basic on/off triggered at the change of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Switch binary report triggered at the changes of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Power meter report triggered at the changes of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Basic on/off triggered at the change of output Q2 and reflecting its state
Switch binary report triggered at the changes of output Q2 and reflecting its state
Power meter report triggered at the changes of output Q2 and reflecting its state
Basic on/off triggered at the change of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Switch binary report triggered at the changes of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Power meter report triggered at the changes of output Q1 and reflecting its state
Basic on/off triggered at the change of output Q2 and reflecting its state
Switch binary report triggered at the changes of output Q2 and reflecting its state
Power meter report triggered at the changes of output Q2 and reflecting its state

Value.label: Input 3 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 second to 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON disabled. 1 second to 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable 3-way switch/additional switch
Value.Help: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3-way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Double click function
Value.Help: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 4. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1. Default value 0.

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. 32536 : offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 : value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 : value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature. Default value 32536.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. 0 : Reporting disabled. 1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value 5 = 0,5C change.

Group.label: Start level change/stop level change input I1
Start level change/stop level change input I1

Value.label: Blinking behavior
Value.Help: Configuration Value 1: 1-255 Configuration Value 1 is to Specify the time that Smart Switch need blink, The unit is Second; Configuration Value 2: 1-255 Configuration Value 2 is to Specify the Cycle of on/off, the unit of it is 0.1 second.

Value.label: Current Overload Protection
Value.Help: Load will be closed when the Current overruns (EU 16.2A) for more than 2 minutes

Value.label: Output Load Status
Value.Help: Configure the output load status after re-power on.

Value.label: Notification status
Value.Help: Defines the automated status notification of an associated device when status changes

Value.label: Configure the state of the LED

Item.label: The LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load. (Default)
When the state of the Switch changes, the LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load, but the LED will turn off after 5 seconds.

Value.label: Enables/disables parameter 91/92
Value.Help: Enable/disable Wattage threshold and percent.

Value.label: Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
Value.Help: The value represents the minimum change in wattage for a Report to be sent (default 25 W)

Value.label: Minimum Change to send Report (%)
Value.Help: The value represents the minimum percentage change in wattage for a Report to be sent (Default 5)

Value.label: Default Group Reports
Value.Help: Set report types for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 1
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 1. 1 is meter report for voltage. 2 is meter report for current. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 kWh bit 2 watt bit 1 current bit 0 voltage

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 2
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 2. 1 is meter report for voltage. 2 is meter report for current. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 kWh bit 2 watt bit 1 current bit 0 voltage

Value.label: Report type sent in Reporting Group 3
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 3. 1 is meter report for voltage. 2 is meter report for current. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 kWh bit 2 watt bit 1 current bit 0 voltage

Value.label: Set 111-113 to default
Value.Help: Set time interval for sending reports for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 1
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 1 is sent.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 2
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 2 is sent.

Value.label: Send Interval for Reporting Group 3
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 3 is sent.

Value.label: Partner ID
Value.Help: Partner ID

Value.label: Configuration Locked
Value.Help: Enable/disable Configuration Locked

Value.label: Device tag
Value.Help: Device tag.

Value.label: Reset device
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Always on function
Value.Help: Once activated, Wall Plug will keep a connected device constantly ON, will stop reacting to alarm frames and B-button push. "Always on" function turns the Plug into a power and energy meter. Also, connected device will not be turned off upon receiving an alarm frame from another Z-Wave device (parameter 35 will be ignored). In "Always on" mode, connected device may be turned off only after user defined power has been exceeded (parameter 70). In such a case, connected device can be turned on again by pushing the B-button or sending a control frame. By default, overload protection is inactive. Default setting: 1

Value.label: Remember device status after power failure
Value.Help: Define how will the Plug react after the power supply is back on. Default setting: 1

Item.label: Wall Plug does not memorize its state after a power failure
Wall Plug memorizes its state after a power failure

Value.label: Reaction to alarms
Value.Help: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 1, activated via input IN1. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

Value.label: Wall Plug's response to alarm frames
Value.Help: Parameter defines how the Wall Plug will respond to alarms (device's status change) Default setting: 0. 0 - no reaction, 1 - turn on connected device. LED ring signals an alarm through defined time period (parameter 39) or until the alarm is cancelled. 2 - turn off connected device. LED ring signals an alarm through defined time period (parameter 39) or until the alarm is cancelled. 3 - cyclically change device state, each 1second. In alarm mode Wall Plug does not report status change, power changes, ignores alarm frames. After the defined time period has passed (parameter 39) or after the alarm cancellation, connected device is set to the previous state. NOTE: If "always on" function is active (parameter 1), this parameter's settings are ignored.

Value.label: Alarm duration
Value.Help: Wall Plug's alarm mode duration. If a device sending an alarm frame through the Z-Wave network sets alarm duration as well, this parameter's settings are ignored. Default setting: 600

Value.label: Immediate power report
Value.Help: Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller, with the highest priority in the Z-Wave network. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug immediately sends power report if the power load changes by 80%. Default setting: 80 (%)

Value.label: Standard power load reporting
Value.Help: Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug sends power report if the power load changes by 15%. By default such changes in power load may be reported up to 5 times per 30 seconds. Wall Plug sends 5 reports during time period specified in paramater 43. Default setting: 15 (%)

Value.label: Power reporting frequency
Value.Help: This parameter defines how frequently standard power reports (parameter 42) will be sent. By default Wall Plug sends up to 5 reports each 30 seconds, provided the power load changes by 15%. Default setting: 30 (s)

Value.label: Reporting changes in energy consumed by controlled devices
Value.Help: New, reported energy value is calculated based on last reported value. Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh). Available settings: 1 - 254 (0,01kWh - 2,54kWh). Value of 255 - changes in consumed energy will not be reported. Reports will be sent only in case of polling. Default Setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.label: Time period between reports on power load and energy consumption.
Value.Help: Parameter defines time period between reports sent when changes in power load have not been recorded. By default, if power load changes have not been recorded, reports are sent every hour. Default setting: 3 600 (s), Available settings: 1 - 65534 (s). Value of 65535 - no periodic reports. Reports will be sent only in case of power load / energy consumption changes (parameters 40, 42, 43,45) or in case of polling. Default setting: 3600

Value.label: Metering energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself. Results are being added to energy consumed by controlled device. Default setting: 0

Value.label: DOWN value
Value.Help: Lower power threshold, used in parameter 52. Default setting: 300 (30W) Available settings: 0 - 25000 (0,0W - 2500W) DOWN value cannot be higher than a value specified in parameter 51. Default setting: 300 (30W)

Value.label: UP value
Value.Help: Upper power threshold, used in parameter 52. Default setting: 500 (50W) Available settings: 1 - 25000 (0,1W - 2500W) UP value cannot be lower than a value specified in parameter 50. Default setting: 500 (50W)

Value.label: Action in case of exceeding defined power values
Value.Help: Parameter deifines the way 2nd association group devices are controlled, depending on the current power load. Default setting: 6. Available settings: 0 - function inactive, 1 - turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50), 2 - turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50), 3 - turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51), 4 - turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51), 5 - 1 and 4 combined. Turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50). Turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51). 6 - 2 and 3 combined. Turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50). Turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51). Default setting: 6

Item.label: Turn the associated devices on,Power below DOWN
Turn the associated devices off,Power below DOWN
Turn the associated devices on,Power above UP
Turn the associated devices off,Power above UP

Value.label: Power load, which when exceeded, makes the LED ring flash violet.
Value.Help: Function is active only when parameter 61 is set to 0 or 1. Default setting: 25000 (2500W) Available settings: 1000 - 32000 (100W - 3200W). Default setting: 25000 (2500W)

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour when controlled device is on
Value.Help: 0 - LED ring illumination colour changes in predefined steps, depending on power consumption changes, 1 - LED ring illumination colour changes continuously, using full spectrum of available colours, depending on power consumption changes. 2 - White illumination, 3 - Red illumination, 4 - Green illumination, 5 - Blue illumination, 6 - Yellow illumination, 7 - Cyan illumination, 8 - Magenta illumination, 9 - illumination turned off completely. Default setting: 1

Item.label: Using full spectrum of available colours

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour when controlled device is off
Value.Help: 0 - LED ring illumination colour takes on the color corresponding to the last measured power at the time when the device controlled was turn off, 1 - White illumination, 2 - Red illumination, 3 - Green illumination, 4 - Blue illumination, 5 - Yellow illumination, 6 - Cyan illumination, 7 - Magenta illumination, 8 - illumination turned off completely. Default setting: 8

Item.label: Depending on the last measured power

Value.label: LED ring illumination colour at the Z-Wave network alarm detection.
Value.Help: 0 - No change in colour. LED ring illumination colour determined by parameters 61 or 62 settings, 1 - LED ring flashes red / blue / white (default), 2 - White illumination, 3 - Red illumination, 4 - Green illumination, 5 - Blue illumination, 6 - Yellow illumination, 7 - Cyan illumination, 8 - Magenta illumination, 9 - illumination turned off completely. Default setting: 1

Item.label: LED ring flashes red / blue / white

Value.label: Oveload safety switch
Value.Help: This function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device will be turned off even if "always on" function is active (parameter 1). Controlled device can be turned back on via B-button or sending a control frame. By default this function is inactive. Default setting: 65535 (6553,5W) Available settings: 10 - 65535 (1W - 6553,5W). Value higher than 32000 (3200W) turns the overload safety switch off, i.e. this functionality is turned off by default. Default setting: 65535 (6553,5W)

Value.label: Input 3 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 second to 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON disabled. 1 second to 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable 3-way switch/additional switch
Value.Help: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3-way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Double click function
Value.Help: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 4. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1. Default value 0.

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. 32536 : offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 : value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 : value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature. Default value 32536.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. 0 : Reporting disabled. 1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value 5 = 0,5C change.

Group.label: Start level change/stop level change input I1
Start level change/stop level change input I1

Value.label: Power delta
Value.Help: Consumer variation required to send notification. From 1 to 100, default 10

Value.label: No communication light
Value.Help: After how many minutes the GreenWave device should start flashing if the controller didn't communicate with this device

Value.label: Room color
Value.Help: The room color (Corner wheel color) on the GreenWave device

Value.label: Power on relay
Value.Help: Relais state after a power loss

Value.label: LED on network error
Value.Help: Enable/Disable the LED on network error

Value.label: Touch sound
Value.Help: This will enable or disable the sound effects when you press or touch the sensing area

Value.label: Touch vibration
Value.Help: This will enable or disable the vibration effects when you press or touch the sensing area

Value.label: Button slide function
Value.Help: This will enable or disable control by sliding the button area

Value.label: Report type
Value.Help: To configure which report will be sent when pressing the buttons

Item.label: Send Central Scene Command Notification and Configuration report

Value.label: Color when button is pressed
Value.Help: To configure which color will be displayed when the button is pressed. Value 1: (msb) Red. Value 2: Green. Value 3: Blue. Value 4: Reserved

Value.label: Test the LED, buzzer and vibrator
Value.Help: Get the LED Strip color value Value 1: (msb) Red. Value 2: Green. Value 3: Blue. Value 4: buzzer and vibrator. (1=ON, 0=OFF)

Value.label: Set the low battery value
Value.Help: Set the low battery value. Range: 10% - 50%.

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: Reset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network
